III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
does not accept DHHS youth; therefore, MISEP compliance is not applicable.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility does not accept DHHS youth; therefore, contract
and policy compliance is not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 128
The facility was advised to more clearly document that each of the required trainings
in the rule is completed.
R 140
The facility was advised to ensure they are documenting and clearly following their
policy on vehicle maintenance. Review and update your policy if needed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Consultation was provided related to submission of covid reporting forms and the
Chief Administrator was reminded to ensure those are emailed timely to the
consultant on the DHHS form.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted no corrective action plans not related to maltreatment
during this licensing period. There have been no investigations at this program for
over four years. The facility continues to demonstrate intention to comply with
4

licensing rules. The Chief Administrator completed the annual assessment and noted
that ongoing internal audits continue, and issues are addressed at the time of the
findings. This has likely contributed to their compliance.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
